title: 109_s981
content: SECTION 1. NONREDUCTION IN PAY DURING ACTIVE SERVICE IN UNIFORMED SERVICES OR NATIONAL GUARD. The "Reservists Pay Security Act of 2005" ensures that federal employees called to active duty in the uniformed services receive nonreduction in pay during their service. The Reservists Pay Security Act of 2005 guarantees that federal employees on active duty in the uniformed services receive full pay and allowances during their service, as long as their civilian employment is not interrupted. Amounts are payable for each pay period when the employee has reemployment rights under chapter 43 of title 38 and does not receive basic pay. The Reservists Pay Security Act of 2005 ensures federal employees on active duty receive full pay and allowances during service, disregarding certain provisions of title 38. Amounts are payable by the employing agency from the appropriate fund. The Reservists Pay Security Act of 2005 guarantees full pay and allowances for federal employees on active duty, paid by the employing agency from the appropriate fund. The Office of Personnel Management, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense, will establish regulations to implement these provisions for agency employees. The Federal Aviation Administration Administrator will also ensure these rights apply to their employees. The Reservists Pay Security Act of 2005 ensures full pay and allowances for federal employees on active duty, with the employing agency responsible for payments. The terms and definitions related to employee rights and basic pay are clarified in the legislation. The Reservists Pay Security Act of 2005 guarantees full pay and allowances for federal employees on active duty, with the amendments applying to pay periods starting on or after the date of enactment of the Act. Retroactive application is conditional on the availability of appropriations from October 11, 2002, through the date of enactment. Authorization of $125,000,000 in appropriations for specified purposes.
